answers.answer: The pills are unpredictable, and often do not work well in pregnancy.If your doctor has told you that you require insulin therapy during pregnancy, it is not a decision made lightly.  The effects of uncontrolled blood sugar on a pregnancy can be dangerous.Take heart; it can be worked into your lifestyle.  And in most cases you can stop after the pregnancy, although some studies show you are more prone to developing diabetes later in life, if you have had it during a pregnancy.Best thing to do after pregnancy, is to address lifestyle and make the kinds of changes that will help prevent this.

question: Why, if diagnosed with gestational diabetes, and need to take insulin, does it have to be injections and not the pills?
title: Gestational Diabetes- Insulin
